s.text: I don't know if you saw the article in Dissent in which Michael Tomasky maintained that "liberals" disagreed with your "broken windows" theory and that the policies of liberal mayors caused the increase in crime in America's cities between 1960 and 1990.
They are simply not using crack, even when they are using other drugs.
At the same time, the annual survey of drug use by the National Institute for Justice shows a change in attitude by the young.
It always struck me as strange that in the period when crime was increasing in cities, politicians blamed the problem on the pathologies in the inner-city communities.
It always struck me as strange that in the period when crime was increasing in cities, politicians blamed the problem on the pathologies in the inner-city communities.
It always struck me as strange that in the period when crime was increasing in cities, politicians blamed the problem on the pathologies in the inner-city communities.
The article is about crack use in poor communities in the inner city.
Also, it was Mayor David Dinkins who found the money to hire 3,000 more police officers in New York under his "Safe Streets Safe Cities" program.
